intro: Ranunculus africanus, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features delicate, palmately divided leaves and showy, yellow flowers with five petals. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in grasslands and rocky areas. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements.
